newsitem.title: CANADA: Bre-X reaches C$3.85 before TSE problems.
newsitem.headline: Bre-X reaches C$3.85 before TSE problems.

text.p: Shares in Bre-X Minerals Ltd soared 1.35 to 3.85 on Tuesday before the Toronto Stock Exchange's computer trading system collapsed, stopping trading in the volatile stock.
About 7.7 million Bre-X shares changed hands after the Calgary-based exploration company issued a statement regarding its controversial Busang gold property.
The stock continued to trade on Nasdaq, gaining 1-1/4 to 3 on 3.4 million shares.

Minutes before the resumption of trade, Bre-X issued a statement saying it will need more time to study a report from Kilborn SNC Lavalin containing data related to a check assay program at the Busang gold project.
